episodes.title: Fear Indoctrination and Mystical Manipulation in Cults
episodes.description:
Before you ask someone - "Why didn’t you leave sooner? Or why don’t you just quit?" You need to understand the powerful dynamics at play inside cults and high-demand groups and some religious organizations.

In today's video, we delve deep into the disturbing world of fear indoctrination, a tactic used by cults and manipulative organizations to control their members. This coercive method focuses on instilling fear to suppress any form of dissent and ensure unwavering obedience. From preaching end-of-the-world scenarios and isolating members from the outside world, to invoking fear of the unknown and the potential loss of one's identity, we'll explore how these tactics play a pivotal role in a member's life. 

The extent of this control even reaches public humiliation sessions often used by LGATs (Large Group Awareness Trainings). By understanding these methods, we aim to shed light on the dangers of such organizations and the psychological grip they hold over individuals. 

Tune in to uncover the layers behind these chilling strategies.

episodes.title: Attacked for Leaving a Cult
episodes.description:
After 12 years of being in a cult, I woke up and left and today I want to talk about being a whistleblower and the process that abusers will use when confronted. 

My intention in shedding light on this is that it will free someone who watches this to be able to leave, to speak out and to not blame or gaslight yourself for the things that the abusers do to you when you finally become strong enough to leave.

*editors note: At 3 minutes in there was a 16 second audio clip of the leader of this group which we were asked to removed as it is proprietary material

DARVO stands for 'Deny, Attack, and Reverse Victim and Offender.' 

Perpetrators often use DARVO to shame victims into believing they are responsible for the abuse.

The original email series I put out that triggered their attack can be found here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mJx-65bbvOqLjWHFGCIJo3zZO9ulDLSudbvXAVydOgE/edit?usp=sharing

Dr. Janja Lalich and her work on Cults, Extremism, & Undue Influence can be found here: https://janjalalich.com/

Janja works to promote a deeper, more accurate understanding of cults with the intent to avoid their manipulation, exploitation, and abuse.

Check out and follow the #igotout movement. 

The mission of #igotout is to inspire survivors of high-demand environments who have experienced cultic, religious, or spiritual abuse to tell and share their stories - if and when it's safe to do so.
